title: My favorite messenger
text: Awhile back I went on a quest to find the best secure messaging app. I downloaded every one I could find and tried them all for at least a couple of days. In the end Telegram came out on top with the best overall functionality and beautiful design. The desktop version is fantastic, too. True, you can find some things lacking, both in function and security, but no app is perfect. Telegram is plenty secure for my purposes and is just a joy to use.

title: Latest update has caused many problems.
text: I adore this app. Perfect on desktop, and right now, since I haven‚Äôt updated it, perfect on my iPad. On my iPhone, I can‚Äôt save received videos to my camera roll any more, scrolling through received media is almost impossible because of how pressing and dragging is perceived as a press and hold, and for some reason many videos I‚Äôve attempted to send have failed to recompress, and I‚Äôve lost multiple videos to accidental deletion this way. Fingers crossed these changes are rolled back, or significant reworked. I miss the old version so much that I only ever use my phone with the current version as a last resort.

title: hope the bug in Telegram gets fixed quickly.

The issue arises when I attempt to view images from a channel. Only a few of the images are displayed, while the older ones fail to load. To assist you in understanding the problem better, I will attach a video demonstrating the issue. title: accessibility for VoiceOver screen reader users is very poor!
text:
Unfortunately, after contacting the support for several months now, I'm ready to give up. It seems as though either no one cares about accessibility, or my messages go to the wrong inbox.
Using Telegram with VoiceOver screen reader is very very difficult. For instance, browsing through channels is nearly impossible. Listening to voice messages sometimes works, especially when attempting to listen to replies. Accepting and rejecting calls with the screen reader is a hit-and-miss experience.
I hope the jeam will start paying more attention to accessibility in the new year!

title: Awesome!
text:
I love how customizable it is, and it is one of the only apps where I can get the notifications to work (I have no idea why, it might not even be bc of the app itself tbh but still helps). The amount of privacy protection is also amazing (can get annoying with multiple devices but worth it).

Only thing is that I wish we could like messages. It‚Äôs a great and simple feature. Handy for when my socially awkward self doesn‚Äôt know a ‚Äúur welcome‚Äù is in order.

userName: Nicki is the queen of Rapüëëüëë
title: Not secure at all.
text:
I‚Äôve been using telegram for a few years now and yesterday my account got hacked. I‚Äôve tried contacting telegram every possible way I can but no one has responded yet. I am very disappointed. I used to think that telegram was like one of the most secure messaging apps. The hacker is still using my account and texting my friends and family pretending to be me. The hacker has access to many private photos of mine and is actually posting them as my profile picture. I am 17 and this is very frustrating. I never imagined something like this would happen to me. 
Very saddened.

title: Doesn't even try fixing bugs
text: It's been OVER AN YEAR since the awful bug where not all messages in a group load (and you have to act like you're in an scavenger hunt and tap on replies for them to show up) has been in TG. This is unacceptable. Instead of fixing bugs that quite frankly destroy the IM experience, they keep pushing updates straight from whatsapp. How about you guys spend more time ensuring we can SEE messages in a messaging app? All my iOS friends have to deal with the same bug! For over an year! How can you just let a widespread game-breaking bug unfixed and instead focus on redesigning small features for the thousandth time?

title: most secure messenger..?
text:
i‚Äôve read other people‚Äôs reviews and i guess the problems they‚Äôve had somehow missed me. there are some chatbots but they never contact me. 
the end to end encryption is better than its competitors, except for really small proprietary apps used by certain corporations. and it‚Äôs not a zuck product. i‚Äôve had no problems with it. 

my tiny minor quibble is the out of control emojis‚Ä¶i mean, they do a show for you practically. but if that‚Äôs the only problem i‚Äôve had, that‚Äôs a decent end user experience. i‚Äôm not a shill. i hate almost every app ive ever used because they all say free app and they lie. all of them. so i guess it‚Äôs level ground from which to enjoin the mel√©e‚Ä¶

title: Excellent implementation of telegram.
text: Nothing from the desktop app is missing, the mobile interface is superb (in portrait), and the Apple Watch app is back and better than ever. Thank you for not abandoning that functionality even though it‚Äôs difficult.   My only complaint is the lack of support for plus and now max (lol) sized iPhones. Give us that iPad style interface please in landscape. It‚Äôs the only gray mark on an otherwise flawlessly executed messaging client.

title: Recordings Under Music Column

I hope you can add this option to help me out. Then I will give this app five stars. 
Thank you

title: Four years of use.
text:
I‚Äôve used this app for four years, and initially found it fast and flawless back in 2019! Of course, as time went by, TG quickly lost its luster, and the cracks started to show.

Don‚Äôt expect support from the staff, they‚Äôre not going to respond any time soon. If at all.

The fact that child pornography groups continue to persist and exist on this app. The sheer amount of users asking for it is sickening.

Let‚Äôs not forget the hate groups and trolls who will screenshot everything so they can try and expose you to their ‚Äúfriends‚Äù as well as open your account up to further harassment.

And lastly, the app is just so bad at loading these days. I shouldn‚Äôt have to exit and re-enter the app just to get my groups to load, load them on the first go!

In short, use Discord or literally anything else. Way more privacy and you don‚Äôt need to use your phone number to sign up.

title: Apple offloaded Telegram from my phone
text: Has this happened to anyone else? I use Telegram several times a day, every day. This afternoon, I noticed I didn‚Äôt have any notifications, so I went to open it up, and my iPhone had automatically offloaded Telegram. I do have my phone set up to automatically offload after 30 days of non-use, but as I stated, I use it ALL THE TIME.

title: Unable to delete account

title: Great app but one big missing feature
text: I love this app. I have no problem with it on laptop. However on phone it is annoying that you can not download files out of the app. It is irritating that I can‚Äôt leave the app before the download finishes. It will only download files while you are out of the app for like 1 minute. If the feature for downloads to be downloading while out of the app is added,the app will be perfect.

title: Great app, could be better
text:
I am satisfied with using this app, it‚Äôs what I use for day-to-day communication with most of my best friends. Although the desktop version has night mode and I feel like I would enjoy having that feature implemented into the app as well for mobile, as the light of the background a strain on my eyes just a bit during that time.
Apart from that little inspection I really have no quarrel with the app and will continue to use it

title: The absolute *best* messaging app
text:
Mainly for cloud integration and being able to use it from any device.
Exceptionally good at speed, security and simplicity.

There are a _lot_ of things to like about this app. Stickers, an image editor, private chats, editing messages, removing messages for everyone in a group, reliability, security... all these things were missing in previous apps I used for messaging.

I also like how Telegram is extremely against censorship, creating proxies as workarounds for country blocks, for example.

However, I am still waiting for video and group calls though, until then I‚Äôll still use FaceTime. I‚Äôd also like forwarding messages to multiple places. Then it‚Äôll be absolutely the *perfect* messaging app.

title: flashback problem

title: Good.  Could improve its interface.
text: This is my go-to messaging app. I love it. That being said, there are a couple things about the interface that always bother me: 1) when you are in a private chat, the self-destruct button is too easy to hit accidentally. It should be moved away from the ‚Äúsend‚Äù button; 2) It should be easier to insert gifs in a message.  The feature is hidden and takes several steps to find.

title: Can‚Äôt get back in

It keeps saying I‚Äôve exceeded my limit and that I need to try again later and I‚Äôm wondering if that‚Äôs because I had logged in and out so many times because of the groupchats im in and that they‚Äôre blowing my phone up so that‚Äôs the only thing I‚Äôm having trouble with. I love the app, I just can‚Äôt log back in ü§∑üèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

title: More Pinned Chats
text: I love using Telegram to connect with others and send commission files. I tend to pin client / frequented group messages at the very top so that I don‚Äôt forget to reply to them, but the 5 chat pin limit can make things a bit difficult at times. I have no qualms with Telegram and look forward to future updates, but I do wonder if it will be possible to pin additional chats in the future.

title: Reckless with your data
text: When you join telegram, they require your phone number. The second you enter your phone number, they alert everyone in your contacts - whether you‚Äôve shared your contacts or not - that you‚Äôve joined telegram. Unfortunately, the US doesn‚Äôt have strict data privacy laws which allows this reckless misuse of your data to happen. In Europe, this is a violation of GDPR and they would be fined up to $20mln. Telegram is misusing customer PII data and is recklessly sharing data without consent. I will be contacting a lawyer to discuss a potential class action lawsuit.

title: Really Colorful and Inviting! Also has good privacy
text: I really like this app a lot and especially how smooth and artistic it is. It‚Äôs pretty much a more ‚Äúalive‚Äù version of WhatsApp with all of the fun little reactions and stuff. It also keeps you phone # hidden from people unless you have them as a contact. All in all great app and definitely recommend.

title: Good service, awful policies
text: Telegram is a good enough messenger but their customer policies are completely misguided. For year, Pavel Durov - Telegram‚Äôs owner and creator has refused to ban groups promoting hate towards women, racial and ethnic minorities, and lgbt. He claims that Telegram won‚Äôt ban those hate groups because that would go against freedom of speech, but those groups operate with much more than just words. So called ‚Äúnational patriarchy‚Äù harasses, intimidates, and attacks Russian feminists and businesses that feature people of color in their commercials. Apple store should not condone such behavior and pressure Telegram to ban hate groups that threaten lives and wellbeing of people.

title: Security vulnerability
text: Dear creators of Telegram, I would like to point out an issue that is very necessary and necessary, and that is that in Iran, because Telegram is blocked, people use many fake versions of Telegram that are not safe at all, or put them in the meetings section.  Have their own active.  I ask you to take action on this issue and disable fake versions of Telegram and make people use Telegram in security.

title: Audio section
text: In the new update I have a big problem with the audio section! The option for stopping an automatic download is not on the list of audios anymore and that‚Äôs really annoying! You can‚Äôt see whether the audio is downloaded or not. So there is no option for you to stop an audio when it‚Äôs downloading automatically or starting the download without playing the audio. You have to go to the chat and stop/start it from there. Big problem
